trans-unit.source: Get started with authentication (Xamarin.iOS) - Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Get started with authentication (Xamarin.iOS) - Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use authentication in your Azure Mobile Services app for Xamarin.iOS.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use authentication in your Azure Mobile Services app for Xamarin.iOS.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your Mobile Services app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your Mobile Services app

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable authentication in your app:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable authentication in your app:

trans-unit.source: [Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services]
trans-unit.target: [Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services]

trans-unit.source: [Restrict table permissions to authenticated users]
trans-unit.target: [Restrict table permissions to authenticated users]

trans-unit.source: [Add authentication to the app]
trans-unit.target: [Add authentication to the app]

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial requires [Xamarin.iOS], XCode 6.0 and iOS 7.0 or later versions.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial requires [Xamarin.iOS], XCode 6.0 and iOS 7.0 or later versions.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Restrict permissions to authenticated users
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Restrict permissions to authenticated users

trans-unit.source: In Xcode, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: In Xcode, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: Press the Run button to build the project and start the app in the iPhone emulator; verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: Press the Run button to build the project and start the app in the iPhone emulator; verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the TodoItem table now requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the TodoItem table now requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Add authentication to the app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Add authentication to the app

trans-unit.source: Open the ToDoService project file and add the following variables
trans-unit.target: Open the ToDoService project file and add the following variables

trans-unit.source: Then add a new method named Authenticate to ToDoService defined as:
trans-unit.target: Then add a new method named Authenticate to ToDoService defined as:

trans-unit.source: If you are using an identity provider other than a Microsoft Account, change the value passed to LoginAsync above to one of the following: Facebook, Twitter, Google, or WindowsAzureActiveDirectory.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an identity provider other than a Microsoft Account, change the value passed to LoginAsync above to one of the following: Facebook, Twitter, Google, or WindowsAzureActiveDirectory.

trans-unit.source: Move the request for the ToDoItem table from the ToDoService constructor into a new method named CreateTable:
trans-unit.target: Move the request for the ToDoItem table from the ToDoService constructor into a new method named CreateTable:

trans-unit.source: Create a new asynchronous public method named LoginAndGetData defined as:
trans-unit.target: Create a new asynchronous public method named LoginAndGetData defined as:

trans-unit.source: In the TodoListViewController override the ViewDidAppear method and define it as found below.
trans-unit.target: In the TodoListViewController override the ViewDidAppear method and define it as found below.

trans-unit.source: This logs in the user if the ToDoService doesn't yet have a handle on the user:
trans-unit.target: This logs in the user if the ToDoService doesn't yet have a handle on the user:

trans-unit.source: Remove the original call to RefreshAsync from TodoListViewController.ViewDidLoad.
trans-unit.target: Remove the original call to RefreshAsync from TodoListViewController.ViewDidLoad.

trans-unit.source: Press the Run button to build the project, start the app in the iPhone emulator, then log-on with your chosen identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Press the Run button to build the project, start the app in the iPhone emulator, then log-on with your chosen identity provider.

trans-unit.source: When you are successfully logged-in, the app should run without errors, and you should be able to query Mobile Services and make updates to data.
trans-unit.target: When you are successfully logged-in, the app should run without errors, and you should be able to query Mobile Services and make updates to data.

trans-unit.source: Get completed example
trans-unit.target: Get completed example

trans-unit.source: Download the [completed example project].
trans-unit.target: Download the [completed example project].

trans-unit.source: Be sure to update the applicationURL and applicationKey variables with your own Azure settings.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to update the applicationURL and applicationKey variables with your own Azure settings.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Next steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Next steps

trans-unit.source: In the next tutorial, [Authorize users with scripts], you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In the next tutorial, [Authorize users with scripts], you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
